column5: While ChatGPT isn't all #opensource, it's hard to resist asking it questions. A solid reply.  My nitpick is it missed our kernel contributions (and many others).  I'm so proud of all the work @RedHat does upstream! Happy #OpenSourceDay

Want to protect your data workloads from prying eyes? TEEs and confidential computing are changing data security and #DataPrivacy. Don't miss our latest episode of Technically Speaking with my guest Lily Sturmann:https://t.co/fMsGGfseMo

Curious about power consumption with your #kubernetes workloads?  Check out Kepler (Kubernetes-based Efficient Power Level Exporter) and ping @root_fs and the Kepler team with your ideas. https://t.co/TO4usjqGur
@vpavlin @KroupaJirka @redhatcz @RedHat @matthicksj Was great! Of course, we missed you, Václav ;) Hope you're well and you're enjoying your new gig
@KroupaJirka @redhatcz @RedHat @matthicksj You did an awesome job, thank you!
@invariantly @nearyd Nice!  I'd expect no less ;)
Looking fwd to connecting with the #ovs community! Hope u can join!

I hope to see you at Red Hat’s Open5G 2022 event! We’ve got an amazing line-up of speakers and topics for telco, media and entertainment companies.  Register here: https://t.co/DeRoDgnQDC
Quick view of event: 
https://t.co/LurgnLO1yk
Ami Badani of @nvidia joins me on Technically Speaking to discuss HW evolution the fundamental changes to more a efficiently process data in aptly named #DataCenter: https://t.co/nZpGmnPsE0

Today's highlight:

Me: #OSS, global collaboration, global impact, curiosity...any questions?

#STEMday student: Can I go to the bathroom?

Wonderful connecting with students today and encouraging curiosity and discussing the value of learning from trying and failing!
Another important milestone in #OSS software supply chain security.  @Sigstore is GA!  https://t.co/TcqbsETvCh
Great to connect with @MassLtGov and discuss ways to broaden reach and build a bigger and more diverse talent pipeline for tech careers. Happy MA #STEM week!
Way to go @fedora! Just finished a smooth update to Fedora 37 Beta. Maintaining high quality and feature velocity together isn't easy!

@FlorianOtel @rogerpasky @dave_tucker @NMoutschen In many ways not visible. But improving resilience for drivers is good for all. And if you knew the flamewars from Linus on the same topic nearly 20yrs ago re: C++ drivers, it is big.

@FlorianOtel @dave_tucker @NMoutschen It's "reasonably" straight fwd. C (for obvious reasons), eBPF (ditto), and @rustlang for it's low-level compat w/ C and tangible improvements re: memory safety, a source of innumerable bugs in C.
@tgraf__ @thomvest @Microsoft @grafana @miraeasset Congratulations!
@arnuIfo_07 Gracias!

@nithyaruff @skeptomai @lizrice Thank you @nithyaruff! I consciously choose not to do product advertisement and consider what's interesting to the audience. Glad to hear it might actually work sometimes ;)
The best part about #RHSummit is that it's free, open and accessible. There's plenty of time to continue the learning and the collaboration!
We all know that software ate the world, and #AI is now eating software. That’s because businesses want to be more data-driven and are leveraging data and AI to get there. #RHSummit

Transparency has always been a challenge with information on #sustainability efforts. The value of the information is zero if people cannot access the data, trust it, or use it. So you need open data and an open platform to create transparency. #RHSummit

#RHSummit isn't Summit without an exchange of ideas, which is what drives open source communities. Check out the Ask the Expert sessions to see what I mean and meet some of the people behind the technology.

Last year at #RHSummit, we talked about shifting security left. This year, see what we’ve done with @RedHat Advanced Cluster Security – moving vulnerability detection into the dev process and de-risking security in software supply chain.
#DevSecOps needs to be seamless from supply chain to the edge. Check out the new #K8s pattern built on @projectsigstore and other security enhancements. #RHSummit
open source supply chain security w/ @projectsigstore, @decodebytes  and @kelseyhightower ... not one to miss!
Looking forward to collaborating on advances in observability, from applications through to hw and accelerators.  You're assembling an amazing team @GregL_Intel!
@twailgum @RedHat @skjerbek @jterrill8 @RedHatJobs We've been super productive virtually, but really nice to make the in-person human connection!
Open source and edge in India, appreciate @anupjayaram's write up as well as our conversation.
Very interesting @RedHat research day presentation today about @openshift supporting astrophysics research.  Building a pipeline never built before, and calculations that can take 1-2yr to complete.

Great discussion with @janerygaard @nokia on #5G, cloud RAN and edge.  Especially the collaborative power of the combined perspectives of cloud native and telecom coming together to build next generation RAN and edge compute.
@lorenc_dan @projectsigstore Been awesome working with you and the broader community!  Takes a village to rethink OSS supply chain security.
evolution of OS level packaging and distribution to broader ecosystem supply chain.  building trust end to end with @projectsigstore and related projects.
Innovation in any industry is rooted in open collaboration. Open standards, open code and open knowledge.
@erinaboyd @RedHat so excited to have you back, erin!
@castrojo @RedHat Given COVID concerns, was remote...so same old snacks in my fridge ;)

Proud to represent @RedHat and #opensource along with many great peers across the industry in an important conversation with the White House today regarding open source and supply chain security.  https://t.co/n8anNQ6HzR
To you amazing passionate #security leaders, we're hiring an important lead security architect role.
@assigajoseph Thank you.  Mike's got great experience and insights.  And thankful to the whole team for bringing these episodes to life!

We self-driving cars today, but what about self-driving IT operations? In my latest episode of Technically Speaking, Sr Architect Mike Dobozy describes a practical view for creating a self-healing infrastructure solution with event-driven automation. https://t.co/s6OPakbCtJ
So great to see this. Long time coming. Thanks to all the knative community members, googlers, and CNCF folks that stuck this out!
Really happy to see this! @projectsigstore is an important part of open source supply chain security, and nice to see the alignment @theopenssf

Join me and @RedHat at #COP26/virtual Nov 8th 13:00-18:00 GMT: @LinuxFoundation OS-Climate demo of #opensource data
& tools for leveraging open tech and community collaboration to support ESG response to climate change. https://t.co/IIMcICo3uC
@stshank I've been serialized into VR, to be resleeved later! ;)

Infra-as-code, config-as-code, continuous compliance and #GitOps...fact or fiction?  In this episode of Technically Speaking, I talk with @StefanProdan about what GitOps is and why it's so valuable. Check it out: https://t.co/8qieKVru4E
@mestery @CycloneTrackXC That's awesome, congratulations! no easy feat... feet? ;)
@gabe_monroy @digitalocean Congrats, Gabe!
@dericop_ @Bancolombia @redhatla Thank you for including me, I enjoyed the conversation!
@guyma Really important point.  Not intended to suggest NA-only, only as a specific proof point of the importance.  It's global, govt's influence each other through policy definitions.

@piparul @somalley108 @jeffvance Takeaways: clean desk surface because I just updated to sit/stand desk, a/v rig is key part of wfh workstation, and window to right keeps me sane ;) https://t.co/SlY6wzp5sK
@gossmanster congrats, John.  i've really enjoyed working with you!  best wishes for next chapter ;)
@kitcolbert Nice, congratulations Kit!
Thank you to @lizrice for joining me and sharing her wisdom regarding shift-left security, #DevSecOps, #eBPF on the latest Technically Speaking episode.  Check it out: https://t.co/rB5wsTbSUv
@DenisMurphyTech @lizrice Great point!  You forgot AI...DevSecNetAIOps... ;)
OH: The other concern is being overrun with zombie processes.

I loved talking with Candace Sheremeta about site reliability engineering in the newest Technically Speaking.  Operating SW, improving it based on user feedback, improving it so it's easier to operate, and writing SW to run the SW.  Great #SRE insights! https://t.co/0yoQnVvMzS
@mairin Eww, traumatizing. The things you can't unexperience...
@aka_pugs Thx, also we got to meet each other!  Love that ;)
@aka_pugs Wow, time flies! Fun to see the lasting impact ;)
@erinaboyd Great idea!  Now I just have to come up with a presentation ;)
@nithyaruff Hehe, could mean "put it down here."  Just don't read the surrounding text ;)
Delivery team still working on basic instructions https://t.co/OCwiG6WbBz
A @wired article on @projectsigstore and open source supply chain security: https://t.co/fbuTcj72o1
@avsm that's great to see!

An opportunity to get involved in establishing a secure root of trust for open source software supply chain w/ @Sigstore Root Key Ceremony: "Tweeting the sha256, publishing on blockchains and more are all helpful! There will be prizes!" https://t.co/7x5gepFTPA
@McCoySmith @richardfontana AFAIK right now it's: gcc (doing), glibc (discussing), gnulib (discussing).  Seems reasonable to expect discussing becomes doing shortly.  Great idea to keep track.
@RichFelker @IanColdwater Thanks Rich, will highlight this (you're not alone!)
@AMShea That's good to know, will highlight
Following on from glibc, gnulib looking at adding DCO to enable contributions w/out requiring FSF copyright assignment.  Great to see this gaining momentum: https://t.co/C3fpeTvTwG
Another positive step towards broadening contribution, glibc opening discussion to allow DCO as well as the existing FSF copyright assignment.  https://t.co/QqiRod275s

Today my grandmother would be 113. 118 years ago Ford produced his first car. Today I used national wireless network to plan cross-continental airline trip and global internet for video conf to discuss project plans for autonomous tractors for smart agriculture. Humbling!
Very cool to see @EventuateIO adding @QuarkusIO support! https://t.co/IqKB0jZu9z
@tgraf__ Completely agree, nursing staff are caring, unsung heroes.  Hope you recover quickly!
@discoposse back when we were travelling... ;)
Removing receive side bottlenecks in network performance with eBPF and CPUMAP...aka really ensuring flows are spread across cpus: https://t.co/5UaHsEriXH
@larsmb Love the longer breaks (and slightly jealous ;) ... but I always thought we shared a calendar.  Last I checked there is no June 31.
@tedroche I hadn't heard that before, but exactly my experience ;)
I just got an out of office reply saying back June 31. Is that never?
@zainroks oof
@jbeda Eureka!
Today's mtg agenda had time management on it.  Sadly we ran out of time to discuss it.

US Executive Order on #Cybersecurity and Supply Chain Security.  Will be important to track this as it will have broad impacts including, I expect, #opensource sw supply chain. (thank you for @projectsigstore!)  https://t.co/pw4wqnjmCx

Next gen, high performance networking distilled.  Great post showing how to take advantage of XDP/eBPF:
https://t.co/vG95kUdt3H
@detiber ahhhh, missed the reference. very cool
@detiber heh, i won't pass judgement on the quality ;)  and lots of ideas is nice way to find good ideas...and there's worse things to be full of!

I think of this differently.  Using common tools and patterns (kube api, declared intent, reconciliation) enables others.  So less universal control plane, more reuse good tools.  Certainly all tools have limitations.
Neolithic Kube, pre-pods. Declare an intent and a custom resource...wow, what would you build?

@Smartree @PaulJCormier I'd guess you didn't load the ip_vs core dependency in all machines the same:
# sysctl -a | grep conn_reuse_mode
# modprobe ip_vs
# sysctl -a | grep conn_reuse_mode
net.ipv4.vs.conn_reuse_mode = 1
I've heard this from other service providers.  Abuse is rampant.  Helps to move from Proof of Work to Proof of Stake. https://t.co/EyPUcPVYAw

Thank you for highlighting Operate First.  Communities have built amazing sw.  Operate First connects the operationalization of that sw back to the community development process.  Improving the tools needed to operate sw, even refining sw architecture making it easier to operate.
Thanks for having me on, that was a really enjoyable conversation!  In my feed, the line wrap for the URL is right at "6g" ... Talk about the future of tech ;)

@ApoosMaximus @hergertme @felipeborges @TheMaxamillion @spotfoss @hughsient I'm a W. Richard Stevens fan, Advanced Programming in the UNIX Environment. His networking books TCP/IP Illustrated are required reading. Inspired by Stevens, Michael Kerrisk wrote The Linux Programming Interface. K&R The C Programming Language is foundational for all above.

Been able to participate in hiring process for 4 leadership roles in last ~quarter.  3 were filled with women.  It's not always a pipeline challenge, but also taking time and attention to ensuring a diverse candidate pool.  Really appreciate the outcome!
Technically Speaking goes on an epic quest as @kelseyhightower joins me to talk #Kubernetes and control planes. Don't miss it! https://t.co/0KbieV9eOo

Thank you @fedora team for another smooth update...off and running w/ F34 beta!
https://t.co/Gm3WFu7rmw
@leifmadsen Hah.  Does that mean I'm an influencer?  BTW, you called that old school...funny thing is I still think of it as new as opposed to: $ tail -f /var/log/messages

Thought I'd glance at logs just to get that "amazing computers even work" feeling...

ERROR:gl_surface_presentation_helper.cc(259)] GetVSyncParametersIfAvailable() failed for 57016320 times!
Saw something today I haven't seen in over a year...a school bus bringing kids home from school!

Words I never expected to see in a SCOTUS opinion: "Consider in more detail just what an API does."  Important precedent set in the decision in Oracle v Google.  While I hoped for a stronger ruling, "fair use" is a win for developers and innovation. https://t.co/Aq3Y6fjXv8
Interesting technology exploration on how crossplane can help you can manage and deploy #Kubernetes Operators in the open hybrid cloud across multiple clouds.  https://t.co/x2T1alXYmL
Congrats team, awesome milestone! Love the usability work: automated upgrade and automated HA, dashboard improvements, rados tracing work, cephfs top, ...so much great work
@JenInnovate Awesome, congratulations Jen!!!

Bad news: Late evening mtg interrupted family time
Good news: Kids made and brought me dinner (grilled cheese and tomato soup)
... now I get to do the dishes

In the latest episode of Technically Speaking, I sat down with Srini Kalapala from @Verizon to talk about 5G - what it is, why it's important, and how open source plays a role in its deployment...was a fun conversation, check it out: https://t.co/K6FZwE9DuQ

I am really outraged by FSF's decision to reinstate RMS. At a moment in time where diversity and inclusion awareness is growing, this is a step backwards. Here's our Red Hat view on the matter:

https://t.co/724R8nhXPG

Love this collaboration with the Google team, and the broader community.  This is the power of open collaboration, and it's how we begin to address challenging OSS supply chain security questions. Kudos to @decodebytes and @lorenc_dan for kickstarting this!
sigstore is here! Very cool to see this community available service regarding open source and supply chain security!  https://t.co/Vd1xa1lsdC
Great to see the unsung heroics of the lower layers of the container stack celebrated, aka the giant shoulders upon which #kubernetes stands...https://t.co/ftq9kbvb9Z
@gabrtv Right on, Gabe. Congratulations!
Fantastic step

Congrats @Opendatahubio on reaching v1.0, great milestone!  @kubeflow  KF Serving and KF Pipeline on @tektoncd and #Argo refresh are just a few examples of integrated work.  Making quick work of data science to production.  Nice job!  https://t.co/rn0AxGoXTw
Looking fwd to this.  Lots to discuss with @BryanHarris about how to effectively enable the business to depend on models in production. #ODSCVirtual
@mestery Funny to think back...I wouldn't have believed you then if you described today...in sooo many ways!  Oh, and have we fixed SDN yet?
Thanks for having me on!  Hanging out, talking about networking, open source, and technology trends...hard to beat!

@djrok212 many interesting topics came up today.  open curriculum, encouraging children towards tech creation beyond just consumption, teach how it works not how to use it (look at what's inside), government support and investment, etc

Thank you for including me in this really important conversation.  The policy to support open source, from early education all the way through to leading industry technologies with open source and open standards will drive our future.  Open unlocks the world's potential!
@DonchoGunchev @redhatopen That's the beauty of technology...vintage looking bulbs are actually LEDs.  It's what I use ;)
@eloycoto @Det_Conan_Kudo @fedora @videolan @OBSProject @gnome yes, vim
@Det_Conan_Kudo @fedora heh, i actually use both.  depends on the task

@Det_Conan_Kudo @fedora @videolan @OBSProject @gnome Thank you for noticing ;)  This has been really fun to put together.  Partially for the content itself.  But also the creative way of bringing my desktop to life ;)

First episode of my new video series, Technically Speaking, is out!  Check out our #EdgeComputing episode w/ @nijaba and @sayeed_azhar.  Edge means different things to different people.  What does it mean to you?   https://t.co/oqh96lJ9ki
